name: Jan Van Balen
body:
Hi, I'm Jan.

I’m a digital music researcher currently working on music discovery at Apple in London.

In 2016, I completed a PhD on music representations and corpus analysis strategies for audio-based music research, at Utrecht University in the Netherlands.

With colleagues at the University of Amsterdam, we made the citizen science games [Hooked!](http://hookedgame.nl/) (NL) and [#hookedonmusic](http://hookedonmusic.org.uk/) (UK), which we developed for a research project on popular music and memory.

I have also worked on content identification (audio fingerprinting, cover detection, sample identification), structure analysis (segmentation, chorus detection), general-purpose music description and other topics in audio signal processing and information retrieval.

Selected publications:

Van Balen, J. (2016). [Audio Description and Corpus Analysis of Popular Music](http://dspace.library.uu.nl/handle/1874/334108). PhD thesis, Utrecht University.

Van Balen, J., Burgoyne, J.A., Müllensiefen, D. & Veltkamp, R.C. (2015). [Corpus Analysis Tools for Computational Hook discovery](http://dspace.library.uu.nl/handle/1874/319538). 16th Society for Music Information Retrieval Conference (ISMIR).

Van Balen, J., Wiering, F. & Veltkamp, R.C. (2015). [Audio Bigrams as a Unifying Model of Pitch-based Song Description](http://dspace.library.uu.nl/handle/1874/314940). 11th International Symposium on Computer Music Multidisciplinary Research (CMMR).

Van Balen, J., Bountouridis, D., Wiering, F. & Veltkamp, R.C. (2014). [Cognition-inspired Descriptors for Scalable Cover Song Retrieval](http://dspace.library.uu.nl/handle/1874/297256). 15th Society for Music Information Retrieval Conference (ISMIR).

Van Balen, J., Burgoyne, J.A., Wiering, F. & Veltkamp, R.C. (2013). [An Analysis of Chorus Features in Popular Song](http://dspace.library.uu.nl/handle/1874/281392). 14th Society for Music Information Retrieval Conference (ISMIR).

Van Balen, J., Serra, J. & Haro, M. (2013). [Sample Identification in Hip Hop Music](http://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-642-41248-6_16). From Sounds to Music and Emotions (post-proceedings for CMMR 2012) (pp. 301-312). Springer Berlin Heidelberg.
